abstract: A Moody’s analyst said JPMorgan Chase’s loss of $2 billion showed big banks were carrying risks that were not fully apparent in their current ratings.
snippet: A Moody’s analyst said JPMorgan Chase’s loss of $2 billion showed big banks were carrying risks that were not fully apparent in their current ratings.
lead_paragraph: A Moody’s Investors Service analyst said on Monday that JPMorgan Chase’s big trading loss underscored the rating agency’s deliberations over whether to cut the credit ratings of 17 global banks.

headline.main: JPMorgan Loss Puts Spotlight on Possible Ratings Downgrade for Global Banks

abstract: A bank that is forced to dump an outsize position could drive prices lower, increasing the size of its eventual losses.
snippet: A bank that is forced to dump an outsize position could drive prices lower, increasing the size of its eventual losses.
lead_paragraph: “If I go there will be trouble, and if I stay it will be double.”

headline.main: How Bank Handles Bad Bet Is Fraught With Peril

abstract: The job of JPMorgan Chase’s chief investment office may have been at odds with its stated goal of reducing risk: it was also supposed to turn its “hedging” trades into a tidy profit.
snippet: The job of JPMorgan Chase’s chief investment office may have been at odds with its stated goal of reducing risk: it was also supposed to turn its “hedging” trades into a tidy profit.
lead_paragraph: At JPMorgan Chase, they called it “the icing” — as in the icing on the cake.

headline.main: The ‘Perfect Hedge’ Remains Elusive at JPMorgan

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

abstract: Calls for a crackdown, which come as regulators are putting the finishing touches on the Volcker Rule and other overhaul measures, may not find many sympathetic ears in Washington.
snippet: Calls for a crackdown, which come as regulators are putting the finishing touches on the Volcker Rule and other overhaul measures, may not find many sympathetic ears in Washington.
lead_paragraph: Conflicting signs are emerging in Washington over whether JPMorgan Chase’s surprise trading loss will spur tighter regulation on Wall Street.

headline.main: In Washington, Mixed Messages Over Tighter Rules for Wall St.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Ed Wyatt

abstract: Despite Jamie Dimon’s recent apologies about the losses, which will most likely be repeated on Tuesday as JPMorgan shareholders gather for the company’s annual meeting, regulators will scrutinize risk management at the chief investment office.
snippet: Despite Jamie Dimon’s recent apologies about the losses, which will most likely be repeated on Tuesday as JPMorgan shareholders gather for the company’s annual meeting, regulators will scrutinize risk management at the chief investment office.
lead_paragraph: In the years leading up to JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss, risk managers and some senior investment bankers raised concerns that the bank was making increasingly large investments involving complex trades that were hard to understand. But even as the size of the bets climbed steadily, these former employees say, their concerns about the dangers were ignored or dismissed.

headline.main: Red Flags Said to Go Unheeded by Bosses at JPMorgan

byline.original: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Nelson D. Schwartz

abstract: Days after disclosing a $2 billion trading loss, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, faced shareholders at the bank’s annual meeting in Tampa, Fla.
snippet: Days after disclosing a $2 billion trading loss, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, faced shareholders at the bank’s annual meeting in Tampa, Fla.
lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla. — Days after disclosing a $2 billion trading loss, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, faced shareholders at the bank’s annual meeting here on Tuesday.

abstract: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is examining potential wrongdoing surrounding JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss, people briefed on the matter say.
snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is examining potential wrongdoing surrounding JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss, people briefed on the matter say.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is examining potential wrongdoing surrounding JPMorgan Chase‘s $2 billion trading loss, people briefed on the matter said Tuesday.

headline.main: F.B.I. Begins Preliminary Inquiry Into JPMorgan

abstract: European Union finance ministers broke an impasse Tuesday and agreed on a plan to force banks to hold more capital as a buffer against the unexpected.
snippet: European Union finance ministers broke an impasse Tuesday and agreed on a plan to force banks to hold more capital as a buffer against the unexpected.
lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — With a $2 billion loss by JPMorgan Chase in London serving as a reminder that risky trading has not gone away, European Union finance ministers broke an impasse Tuesday and agreed on a plan to force banks to hold more capital as a buffer against the unexpected.

headline.print_headline: European Leaders Back Stricter Rules for Banks

abstract: On Tuesday, the House Agriculture Committee postponed a hearing on three bills that aim to ease crucial aspects of the Dodd-Frank financial regulatory overhaul.
snippet: On Tuesday, the House Agriculture Committee postponed a hearing on three bills that aim to ease crucial aspects of the Dodd-Frank financial regulatory overhaul.
lead_paragraph: Will Wall Street pay the price for JPMorgan Chase‘s trading debacle?

headline.main: JPMorgan Loss Leads Lawmakers to Delay Debate on Dodd-Frank
